MEET+GREET+WINE TASTING w/complimentary Cheese and Charcuterie Bites May 9, 2024 5:30pm - For The Love Of Wine For The Love Of Wine Cheers! Events Naples (Paradise Coast) Los Angeles Curated Love for Wine The Extraordinary League of Gentlemen Wine Snobs Gentlemen Gatherings The Irrefutable Dames of Wine Snobbery ‚Äì Naples Dames Gatherings Beverly Hills Wine Club Partner With Us We collaborate with the finest Contact Privacy Policy Posted on by Exceptional Wine Experiences MEET+GREET+WINE TASTING w/complimentary Cheese and Charcuterie Bites May 9, 2024 5:30pm MEET+GREET+Wine Tasting w/complimentary Cheese and Charcuterie Bites Thursday May 9, 2024  5:30-7pm ( FULLY RESERVED ) Naples Wine Society ‚ÄúNestled in the heart of Naples in the Park Shore Mall (Fresh Market, Homegoods), Naples Society Wine Bar showcases more than 200 wines to order by the glass or the bottle, craft beers, non alcoholic beverages, and gourmet food pairing options. Wine flights start at $20, sparkling flights at $25. Naples Wine Bar offers weekly wine tastings by certified hosts on Tuesdays and Wednesdays at 7 pm and a Wine Club allowing locals to discover hidden gems from around the world. Naples Society Wine Bar runs weekly special offers and sparkling Sundays. All wines are available for retail purchase.‚Äù For this gathering, you‚Äôll step up to the bar to discuss and order your personalized ‚ÄúWine Flight Tasting‚Äù consisting of 1 sparkling wine, 2 whites & 2 reds (or 4 reds). Cost for this Naples Society Wine Flight is $20-25. Wines by the glass/bottle and small bites available for purchase. As mentioned, a limited offering of cheese and charcuterie for the group to nosh on compliments of the host, Jason. As a wine appreciation group we learn more about wine through tasting wines from all over the world, by discussing with fellow group members what we taste and enjoy, and through an ever growing understanding of how wine is made. Come out and meet your fellow wine-loving group, chat about your favorite wine, favorite wine region or that time you visited Chianti in Italy. Whatever the topic, enjoy the sense of community that wine affords us in this place we call paradise. Relax, enjoy and savor a wonderful and fun time with this warm inviting group‚Ä¶Cheers! Naples Society Wine Bar Park Shore Plaza Mall , next to Escargot 41 restaurant, in back corner of mall 4333 Tamiami Trail N Naples, FL 34103 239-234-5113 Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on Instagram (Opens in new window) Instagram Click to share on WhatsApp (Opens in new window) WhatsApp Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) Pinterest Click to share on LinkedIn (Opens in new window) LinkedIn Click to share on Reddit (Opens in new window) Reddit Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X More Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Email Click to print (Opens in new window) Print Click to share on Pocket (Opens in new window) Pocket Discover more from For The Love Of Wine Subscribe to get the latest posts sent to your email. About Us - Naples Hotel - Naples, NY Hotel BOOK A ROOM About About Us A Haunted History The Hotel The Restaurant + Bar The Restaurant Our Lunch Menu Our Dinner Menu The Bar Our Beer & Wine Menu Our Cocktail Menu Event Venue Finger Lakes Area Employment Contact Us Over a Century of History: The Naples Hotel. From 1818 to 1895: The History of the Property The Naples Hotel, a local landmark with over a century of history, began as a stop-over for travelers‚Äî a scenic midway stop between Canandaigua and Bath. In 1818, a pioneer named Simeon Lyon built a simple two-story wooden structure on the site of the current hotel, calling it the Lyon Tavern. This original site encompassed almost all the business district today in Naples. Soldiers under George Washington or his commanders assembled in the large park to the North of the tavern to train in uniform once a year. The tavern was a stopping point on the old stagecoach line between Geneva, Dansville, and Bath, before the railroad was built. Coaches would stop at the inn for the night for a home-cooked meal and a change of horses before continuing on the next day. For years the tavern was the only structure on what now is Main Street Naples. Eventually, Simeon Lyon built several other buildings on the property, creating the first business development of Naples a mile South of where the pioneer settlement initially began in Naples. In 1854, a man named James Kearney purchased the property and ran the Lyon Tavern until 1857, then sold the building and land to Carlton Jaqua in 1863, who managed the tavern for an additional 30 years where it became known as the Jaqua House. In 1893, the tavern was sold again to Jeff Brown. He sold the old wooden tavern structure originally build by Simeon Lyon , which was removed from the property. He then build the brick structure‚Äî the very same still standing today‚Äî in 1895. The original garden and park are now business blocks in Naples. Read About Our Haunted History Book a Historical Room Book Now Book a Haunted Room Book Now Meet the Team Tom & Destiny Salviski , Proprietors Our weekend trips throughout the Finger Lakes have often included a stop in the Naples area.¬† The Naples Hotel was always a favorite on our list, and we have enjoyed drinks and food at the hotel many times over the years.¬† When the property came up for sale in 2020, it was just too good to pass up.¬† The building is amazing, the town of Naples is full of charm and the proximity to some of our favorite vineyards made this choice a no-brainer.¬† We decided to take the leap and purchased the property with the hopes of adding an updated touch yet preserving the unique flavor that it offers to travelers.¬† As local Naples residents with three young children, we hope to preserve this piece of history for many generations to explore and experience. Mike Salviski , Marketing/Investment Partner Mike Salviski started his working career as a¬†traveling consultant. ¬†After 20 years of business and pleasure travel, he realized he had done over 1000 nights in a hotel, and one can assume a similar number of drinks at the hotel bar.¬† With a background in Product Development and Hotel dealings, Mike is taking on Marketing and Customer Experience for the Naples Hotel.¬† Feel free to reach out to Mike with any ideas and suggestions to improve your stay at the Naples Hotel. In the Media. One of New York‚Äôs 11 Finger Lakes Hike through Grimes Glen to two 60‚Ä≤ waterfalls; there is a 3rd, but it‚Äôs only for the daring to access. Pick grapes at Jerome‚Äôs U-Pick , then make a stop at Monica‚Äôs Pies . Take in the view of the Bristol Hills from ‚ÄúThe Jump Off‚Äù in Ontario County Park at Gannett Hill . Eat at Roots Cafe or the Naples Hotel . Tipping Glass: A Naples Speakeasy You hear the term ‚Äúspeakeasy‚Äù and don‚Äôt immediately expect to visit Naples, NY ‚Äì a small bucolic town at the south end of¬†Canandaigua Lake. But that is exactly where you will find the¬†Tipping Glass, a speakeasy exclusively featuring Finger Lakes wine, spirits and beer. Wine Trail Map Ready to plan your visit? Check out the official Trail Map below, constantly being updated with new and exciting things to do in the Finger Lakes! Bringing New Life to an Old Favorite Under new ownership, the Naples Hotel is ready to be brought into the 21st Century but still maintain its historic charm. Photos by Tim Aten Naples Winter Wine Festival By Samantha Roesler samantha.roesler@gulfshorebusiness.com 26 January 2024 Naples Society Wine Bar brings winetasting concept to Collier County Naples Society Wine Bar celebrated its grand opening Jan. 12, bringing a new wine-tasting experience to Collier County. Located in a former salon space of the Fresh Market-anchored Park Shore Plaza off U.S. 41, Naples Wine Bar aims to be a place for all levels of wine enthusiasts to enjoy both new and familiar tastes while learning how it‚Äôs made.
